newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portuguese bonds close off lows in nervous session.
newsitem.headline: Portuguese bonds close off lows in nervous session.

text.p: Portuguese bonds closed weaker in nervous trade amid fears over a further U.S. rate hike, and dealers said they could fall further if foreign bonds remain under selling pressure.
"We closed off the lows, but sharply down, and no one can be sure of the trend over the short term," said one fixed rate director.
Another said: "Up to five-year maturities, there are no big sales, despite the slide of the dollar. The problem is the 10-year bonds, which are highly influenced by events abroad."
